title: Employer Nomination Scheme visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Employer Nomination Scheme (ENS) visa, subclass 186, which allows skilled workers nominated by an employer to live and work permanently in Australia. It outlines eligibility criteria, priority processing rules, visa streams, costs, and indicative processing guidance.

structured_data.description: This visa lets skilled workers, who are nominated by their employer, live and work in Australia permanently.
basic_eligibility: You must have the necessary skills for the job
You must be nominated by an Australian employer
You must meet health and character requirements

priority_order: Applicants working in occupations carried out in a designated regional area
Applicants working in a healthcare or teaching occupation
Applicants nominated by an accredited sponsor
program_information.migration_program_planning_levels_2025_2: 44,000 places for ENS visas (primary and secondary visa grants)

processing_allocation_guidance.note: Timeframe not definitive; provided only as a guide.

streams.description: This visa lets skilled workers, who are nominated by an employer, live and work in Australia permanently.
eligibility: You must be nominated by an Australian employer
Your occupation must be on the relevant list of eligible skilled occupations
You must have at least Competent English
streams.processing_time_note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent decisions; guide only.

streams.description: This visa lets skilled workers who are nominated by their employer live and work in Australia permanently. This stream is for workers employed by an employer who is party to a labour agreement.
eligibility: The employer must have a labour agreement
streams.processing_time_note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent decisions; guide only.

streams.description: This visa lets skilled workers, who are nominated by their current employer, live and work in Australia permanently.
eligibility: You must hold a subclass 457, 482 or eligible bridging visa
Usually, you must have worked in eligible sponsored employment on a full-time basis for at least two years
You must be nominated by your employer
streams.processing_time_note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent decisions; guide only.
